intro: Senecio renardii, commonly known as the Renard's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Senecio renardii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
